system.appearance: Appears as a human, or other species, but with wings.

overview.base:
Bless Self in a ritual that improves your @L[Ability:Divine Gift]{Divine Gift}. It follows the same rules as that ritual, but allows you to revise and strengthen that ritual's effects. Remind the @L[Core:GM]{GM} of the effects of your Divine Gift, as they determine the effects of this ritual.
Note: Keep track of your original @L[Ability:Divine Gift]{Divine Gift's} effects. If you loose or become @L[Keyword:Incapable]{incapable} of Bless Self, your Divine Gift returns to the state it was in before. If you loose or become @L[Keyword:Incapable]{incapable} of @L[Ability:Divine Gift]{Divine Gift}, then you loose the effects of Bless Self.

value.variable: You may sacrifice any amount of mana as a part of this ritual.
You may sacrifice any amount of health as a part of this ritual.

costs.materialCost: You may sacrifice any material components as a part of this ritual, but you must have a symbol of your deity present.

system.requirements: You already have a @L[Ability:Divine Gift]{Divine Gift}. This ritual can typically be used only once.

overview.base:
Divine Gift is a ritual that allows you to call upon their deity for a blessing. As part of this ritual, you make a sacrifice to your deity. You can decide exactly what this sacrifice entails. It may be @L[Core:MP]{MP}, @L[Core:HP]{HP}, magical items, vows of service, or anything else that you and your @L[Core:GM]{GM} agree upon. Once the sacrifice is complete, your @L[Core:GM]{GM} determines the blessing your deity grants you.
Note: Although a @L[Core:Short Rest]{short rest} is the standard amount of time it takes to perform this ritual, you may choose to spend more or less time on it. Your @L[Core:GM]{GM} will choose how your deity interprets this.
Note: While some deities may be interested in a large sacrifice, others may be more interested in the intent behind it. Your Divine Gift ritual should be tailored towards what your deity values. You are free to request something specific in your sacrifice, but your deity may choose to grant you something else.
Note: The blessing granted by your deity may have flaws or unexpected consequences.
Note: Although this ability is @L[Category:Sustained abilities]{sustained}, you do not need to re-execute Divine Gift to regain its effects if you temporarily become @L[Keyword:Incapable]{incapable} of it.

value.variable: You may sacrifice any amount of mana as a part of this ritual.
You may sacrifice any amount of health as a part of this ritual.

costs.materialCost: You may sacrifice any material components as a part of this ritual, but you must have a symbol of your deity present.

system.requirements: This ritual can typically be used only once.

overview.proficient: You instead fly at @L[Core:Movement Speed]{full speed}.

overview.base: You gain @L[Ability:Improved Strength]{Improved Strength} and @L[Ability:Melee Damage Boost]{Melee Damage Boost}. In addition, you are no longer suffer the consequences of @L[Property:Cumbersome]{cumbersome} items.
You gain @L[Ability:Beastly Strength]{Beastly Strength} and @L[Ability:Improved Armor Piercing]{Improved Armor Piercing}.

Can wield @L[Property:Two-Handed]{two-handed} weapons in one hand.
Note: @L[Property:AP]{AP} weapons must still be wielded in two hands to be @L[Property:AV0]{AV0}.
Melee weapons you use are @L[Property:Armor Piercing]{armor piercing}.
You may spend an unused @L[Core:Active Maneuvers]{action} to @L[Keyword:Boosted]{boost} the triggering @L[Core:Damage]{damage}.
overview.proficient: You may spend an additional unused @L[Core:Active Maneuvers]{action} to @L[Keyword:Boosted]{boost} the triggering @L[Core:Damage]{damage} again.

system.trigger: You have hit a creature with a @L[Category:Damaging effects]{damaging} melee @L[Category:Weapon delivery abilities]{weapon} @L[Category:Attack abilities]{attack}.

overview.base: You go @L[Condition:Ethereal]{Ethereal} or manifest back into the Material Realm.

results.hit: Target @L[Core:Healing]{heals} at the start of their next turn.

overview.base: At the start of each of your @L[Core:Turns]{turns}, you @L[Keyword:Warded]{warded} @L[Core:Revitalizing]{revitalize} and regain that many @L[Core:MP]{MP}. This does not consume your @L[Core:MP]{mana die}. If you were @L[Condition:Dead]{dead}, this brings you @L[Condition:Alive]{back to life} with the number of @L[Core:MP]{MP} you rolled and 1 @L[Core:HP]{HP}. You only @L[Condition:Dead]{die} due to @L[Core:MP]{MP} loss if you start your @L[Core:Turns]{turn} without successfully regenerating @L[Core:MP]{MP}.

system.limitation: Can only revitalize MP spent on divinely powered abilities .

overview.base: At the start of each of your @L[Core:Turns]{turns}, you @L[Keyword:Warded]{warded} @L[Core:Healing]{heal} and regain that many @L[Core:HP]{HP}. This does not consume your @L[Core:HP]{hit die}. If you were @L[Condition:Dead]{dead}, this brings you @L[Condition:Alive]{back to life} with the number of @L[Core:HP]{HP} you rolled and 1 @L[Core:MP]{MP}. You only @L[Condition:Dead]{die} due to @L[Core:HP]{HP} loss if you start your @L[Core:Turns]{turn} without successfully regenerating @L[Core:HP]{HP}.

overview.proficient: If target is undead, they are @L[Core:Healing]{healed} for Damage @L[Core:Proficiency Bonus]{P} times.
overview.fluent: If target is undead, they are @L[Core:Healing]{healed} for Damage @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{F} times.

results.hit: If target is @L[Condition:Dead]{dead}, they are brought back to life. If they had less than 1 @L[Core:HP]{HP}, they have 1 @L[Core:HP]{HP}. If they had less than 1 @L[Core:MP]{MP}, they have 1 @L[Core:MP]{MP}. Otherwise, their @L[Core:HP]{HP} and @L[Core:MP]{MP} do not change. If target is undead, you can choose to have them be @L[Core:Healing]{healed} for Damage.

system.heightened: For each additional @L[Core:MP]{MP} spent, target can have been @L[Condition:Dead]{dead} for an additional 10 minutes. If target is undead, they are @L[Core:Healing]{healed} an additional time.
system.requirements: Target is undead or has @L[Condition:Dead]{died} within the last 10 minutes.

overview.base:
You may @L[Core:Block Interaction]{block} with a @L[Core:Block Interaction]{BV} equal to your @L[Core:Armor Class]{AV} for the purpose of Shattering Armor.
Note: This does not allow you to delivery other @L[Core:Block Interaction]{blocks} in this way.

results.save: @L[Category:Equipment]{Equipment} that delivers @L[Category:Attack abilities]{attack} you @L[Core:Block Interaction]{block} becomes @L[Property:Shattered]{shattered}.

overview.base: You can @L[Category:Block abilities]{block} non-@L[Keyword:Warded]{warded} @L[Keyword:UB]{UB} @L[Category:Attack abilities]{attacks} with your @L[Category:Shields]{shields}. Any effects that would turn off or cut through @L[Keyword:Resistance]{resistances} affect this as well.
